comments:
When running the JUnit test using the IAC instead of the RAC, the 
execution file does not get created on the Test Navigator. But when you
use the RAC and run the JUnit test, the execution file gets created to 
see result file is generated in Test Navigator.

How to reproduce:

Use windows XP 
Using the IAC
Install TPTP-4.1.0-200511170100 over eclipse
Create a java project, File;New;Project
Create a JUnit test, File;New;Other
Select TPTP JUnit Test 
Click the tab "Test Methods" and add couple or more test case
Click the tab "Behavior" and add invocation, select all testcase 
Run the JUnit test Run;Run

Using the RAC from the build TPTP-4.1.0-200511170100 (Windows-IA32)
Use the steps above, but this time use the RAC to run the JUnit test.
You will see the execution file is created on the Test Navigator.

I was unable to reproduce with the November, 17 build you list below -- please
try to remove the %TEMP%/IBMRAC directory if it exists.  I believe there is some
temporary IAC state that is stored here that might influence the behavior seen
in this defect description.  After removing this temporary IAC directory restart
and try agian. 

Re-rest to see if you can get it to fail again.

An InactiveProcessException is thrown and shows up in the PDE error log and it therefore appears to be failing waiting for process notification of successful launch (launch of the session process).  It fails before the test is deployed and executed and therefore no execution results are seen when using IAC.

Only reproduce on some machines with the Sun JDK.
It would need further investigation.
Re-targeted to 4.2.

This needs to be examined in more detail within the IAC code via Samson or other on that team.  I just tested running a simple JUnit test on IAC and here are the results:

o  IBM JDK 1.4.2 and 5.0 behave correctly (test runs and logs results)
o  Sun JDK 5.0 behaves correctly (test runs and logs results)

The following VM, Sun JDK 1.4.2 (1.4.2_09-b05), behaves badly by having issues with launching the test runner process (the test session VM instructs the agent controller to launch the runner process and the runner process is never seen launched):

eclipse.buildId=I20060208-0848
java.version=1.4.2_09
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.InactiveProcessException
at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.launch(TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.java:417)
at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTestExecution(TestExecutionHarness.java:2058)
at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.access$2(TestExecutionHarness.java:1856)
at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$2.run(TestExecutionHarness.java:692)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I'm not sure how serious this issue is now since all 1.5 and later VMs behave nicely with this -- but anybody wanting to use Sun JDK 1.4.2 (1.4.2_09-b05)
Hello. We have just tested the same scenario using the latest TPTP 4.2 development build with Sun 1.4.2_09-b05 and it now works fine. Please verify. Thanks.
